summary: Migrate from base/basictypes.h standard types to use stdint.h instead.
title: Migrate from base/basictypes.h standard types to use stdint.h instead.

comments.content:
The <stdint.h> header provides sized-integer types (int8_t and friends), for which Chrome currently has its own definitions (int8 and friends) in base/basictypes.h.

<stdint.h> is now well-supported in all but pre-VS2010 toolchains, so we would like to migrate Chrome code to use the standard types as defined in <stdint.h>, and remove the basictypes.h definitions.  This requires providing stdint.h type definitions for use under VS2008, as some third-party libraries (e.g. Skia) already do.

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/chromium-dev/SEbh9WVx2EQ

VS2008 is no longer a supported toolchain; that might affect our migration strategy here.
Yes, should be straightforward (if time-consuming) to switch now.

I was going to use a Clang tool for this conversion. However, the run_tool.py script currently doesn't support inserting headers. It'd also be nice to update it to remove base/basictypes.h if it's no longer needed... but that might be hard to get right.

Yoink.

I have a plan:
1. Include <stdint.h> in basictypes.h even on Windows.
2. Slowly convert int8 -> int8_t, etc. and add includes of <stdint.h>.
3. Move macros in basictypes.h to macros.h or something like that (or other appropriate headers).
4. Delete basictypes.h.
5. Profit.

Just wanted to comment that with Chromium r232425 it is now possible to unconditionally include stdint.h in basictypes.h and have everything work out, even on vs2010e, *except* for MurmurHash3.h. The reason for this is that MurmurHash3.h tests for msvc and does 'typedef unsigned long uint32_t', but Microsoft's stdint.h does 'typedef unsigned int uint32_t'. These a both 'correct' in that both of these are 32bits on Windows, but they do conflict. I have proposed changes at https://code.google.com/p/smhasher/issues/detail?id=18 and attempted to contact the owners, but have had no response. If this header can be fixed, then the plan in Comment #8 can be started.

Make sdch not use an incompatible stdint.h.

We force-include our own logging.h, which includes basictypes.h, which
now includes stdint.h. Without this change, this ends up being
minimal/hacky stdint.h (from sdch/open-vcdiff/vsprojects), which isn't
sufficient for the needs of the rest of basictypes.h.

*** ATTENTION REVIEWERS ***

I'm removing old typedefs of non-_t types, but that would leave basictypes.h empty except for includes, so I'm removing that, too. I therefore have to go out and insert all the includes that the files assume are included but aren't.

In particular:

"DISALLOW_" -> "base/macros.h"
"arraysize" -> "base/macros.h"
"OS_*", "build/build_config.h"
"ARCH_CPU_" -> "build/build_config.h"
"size_t" -> "stddef.h"
"ptrdiff_t" -> "stddef.h"
"(u?int(8|16|32|64))_t" -> "stdint.h"

The following revision refers to this bug:
  https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/c9cec102fb11a2f3ca3156244446da2d3cdc36b8
